H0.text: What is the name of the five horizontal lines on and between which musical notes are written. Ledger

H1.text: What is the name of the five horizontal lines on and between which musical notes are written. Clef

H2.text: What is the name of the five horizontal lines on and between which musical notes are written. Bar

H3.text: What is the name of the five horizontal lines on and between which musical notes are written. Stave

A4.text: The staff (UK also stave; plural: staffs or staves), also occasionally referred to as a pentagram, is a set of five horizontal lines and four spaces that each represent a different musical pitch.

A5.text: Notes outside the range of the staff are placed on or between ledger lines—lines the width of the note they need to hold—added above or below the staff.
